tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Anhs Brush With Fame
programme.desc: Talented Darwin girl Jessica Mauboy joins Anh in his arts studio to talk about her journey to chart and television success, and the family that made it possible.

programme.title: The Art Of Motherhood
programme.desc: Namila explores how art can help us understand motherhood. Featuring artist Atong Atem, writer and podcaster Elizabeth Day, Kelly-Dawn Hellmrich of Camp Cope, Mother of the House Of Alexander Ella Ganza and Prof. Mary Beard.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A series of death notices in the Oxford Mail, each with a distinctive, cryptic message, provides clues to Endeavours latest - and final - investigation. Meanwhile, Thursday is under pressure from a familiar face. (Final)

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: AFL fanatics John and Rosie have bought an iconic 19th century gasworks building overlooking the North Melbourne Football Club and oval, and they want to turn into their dream home. (Final)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The story of a mother who has never recovered from the moment she knew she would be unable to keep her baby and a daughter who has spent her life longing for the chance to be a part of her mothers life. (Final)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz with a difference, looking at a whole Kit and Kaboodle of K topics. Panellists include Australian comedian Colin Lane.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: The dark world of online sextortion targeting teenage boys on social media. With unprecedented access to police and tech experts, to examine how these networks operate, their motivations, and the true devastation they cause.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump has invited Australias Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to Washington DC for their first one-on-one meeting in person. Chas and John discuss what it all means for trade, AUKUS, defence and US-Australia relations.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Rafael Bonachela, the artistic director of Sydney Dance Company says he was born to dance: but while that love took him to the top of contemporary dance, it splintered his family: now comes the dance to reconcile that.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Paul and Amy Wilkinson build a lakeside home in Lincolnshire made up of five circular timber buildings. But Pauls health suffers as he struggles to get this complicated build finished in just 12 months.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: Wake up to the latest news and information as James Glenday and Bridget Brennan present an early start for News Breakfast to cover Anthony Albaneses meeting with US President Donald Trump in Washington DC.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: Ride Of Her Life - Saya Sakakibara
programme.desc: BMX golden girl Saya Sakakibara dreamed of sharing Olympic glory with her brother Kai. When a racing accident almost took his life, Saya had to overcome crippling fear and ride for both of them.

programme.title: Sharon and Ozzy Osbourne: Coming Home
programme.desc: This intimate documentary follows the final three years of Ozzys life as he and Sharon plan a return home after 25 years in LA, and prepare for the ultimate farewell gig.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: Milton Terrace at Millers Point in Sydney was sold off for $4.25M in 2015 as part of the NSW Governments disposal of 300 public housing buildings. For property developer Michael Stokes, its a Mayfair terrace in the making.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We meet a couple searching together for the son they had to give up for adoption when they were teenagers and for the first time we feature a dad searching for the daughter he had to leave when she was just a year old.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: End Game with Tony Armstrong
programme.desc: Tony Armstrong, the former AFL player turned award-winning broadcaster travels to the UK, as he starts a global search for solutions that could help drive systemic change back home.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors choose some of their favourite moments including an experiment to find out what happens when you cough and a life-changing operation that allows someone to hear for the very first time.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears become terribly ill and Chole takes it upon herself to take care of them. But things get trickly when word of the Bears sickness goes viral.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its milkshake time in the lab as the Doctors investigate how blood travels around your body - but will their own ideas for brilliant blood vessel machines impress the minis?

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is attempting to learn how to ballroom dance using Pidsley as his dancing partner. The din they create annoys the sheep so much that Shaun decides he has to do something to stop them.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Could farts power a rocket? And Gladiator Dynamite tests Dr Dan and Dr Raphs dunking skills in an epic Body Battle!

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: In this show, theres more drama than you can shake a pugil stick at when Comet flies in Hang Tough and Diamond races up the Wall.

programme.title: Officially Amazing Goes Bunkers
programme.desc: Awesome quad bike, 2wheelboard and motorcyle jumping are needed today if these record attempts are going to succeed.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Panda needs to meet his brothers at the most exclusive restaurant in town. But when he loses his contacts lenses and cant see, Panda needs Charlies help to get him into the city.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Is Dr Xand finally allowed to eat in the lab or are the doughnuts for an experiment? Find out as the Doctors explore blood types and try to fight off unwanted invaders in game mode.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer discovers his old golf clubs and decides to knock a few balls around in the field, instantly putting his back out.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors investigate noisy tummy rumbles and also share the Top 5 Bizzare-est Body Parts You Never Knew You Had! Plus, Dr Chris looks at the reality of fake organs.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve sets sail to Bali on a diving adventure for a giant ocean sunfish. He rescues fish trapped in an abandoned net and meets the teenagers fighting to ban plastic bags on the island.

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews Yungblud
programme.desc: In a Paris hotel, during the European leg of his tour, Louis and Yungblud sit down to discuss a range of topics - including his mental health, his sexuality and his response to outspoken critics.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a snot-tastic dose of Ouchology when the doctors face tough medical questions, and a VIP guest is due in the lab but with a long list of requests, will the Doctors be ready for their arrival?

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Shaggy takes the Gang to the Minor League Baseball stadium of his youth only to learn that its about to be shut down because a Ghostly Baseball Player is scaring away the fans - and the team!

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Does Dolos really have a lead on finding Ants grandparents? Or is he leading the Nektons into a dangerous chasm between moving tectonic plates for nefarious purposes?

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When the Girls go to Camp, Blossom has a hard time leaving her schoolwork at home.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Batman and Commissioner Gordon go camping, but instead of fun outdoor activities, theyd rather watch TV.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Orla is kicked off the squad when a library book she took out 400 years ago is overdue. The Mobile Unit must use budgeting to turn their $1 into $10 to pay the late fee, or else Orla will not get her badge back.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Ouch Awards is back! We reveal the four winners as the doctors surprise them at home.

programme.title: Dr Anns Secret Lives
programme.desc: Dr Ann Jones joins a team of intrepid scientists on a daring expedition off the Pilbara coast to study one of Australias most mysterious and lethal predators: sea snakes.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Appliances In The Bath / Killer Quicksand / Exploding Tattoo
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie have a MythBuster meltdown, plus they find themselves in over their heads to make killer quicksand and, see what happens when tattoos and technology meet... can body art go boom?

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.sub-title: Waiter, Theres Confetti in My Magic
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Laurent Piron, Mark Clearview, Glenn West and Abby Segal.

programme.title: Rage Guest Programmer: Ruel
programme.desc: Celebrating the release of his new album Kicking My Feet, Ruel takes over the red couch for his second stint hosting rage.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Chris finds himself in an uncomfortable spot as he goes head-to-head with Dr Xand in a man v monkey contest to show you the power of your pelvis!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred switches places with Jeff, the tour guide at a history museum, to give him a chance to lead the gang in solving a mystery.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A mysterious dolphin in a sophisticated electronic harness zaps all the power from the Rover! Ant and Fontaine manage to remove the harness, but can they rehabilitate this cybernetic dolphin to survive in the wild?

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: While going through the Professors scrapbook, Bubbles starts to question if shes ever been a hero.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Outraged when their favourite cartoon is rebooted, the Titans come up with a plan to get the new show off the air.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The Mobile Unit is called to investigate an odd tunnel that some agents have disappeared into. When Omar insists they drive the van through the tunnel, he ends up stuck in a white void all alone and must figure how to escape.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: In this special episode the doctors investigate food and poo to show you why its important to know what youre eating and look after your body!

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Neil and Jackie Harris are desperate for more space for them and their two boys. But Phil discovers a house with a spiral stairway hiding mounds of clutter, a garden full of rubble and a bathroom from the past.

programme.title: Austin
programme.desc: Austin fakes pop culture tastes to sell books. Ingrid starts her job as creative director of the new show and is confronted by the star, Rodger Corser wanting to change things. Julian bonds with Rodger and ruins everything.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, Moon Baby is playing a hiding game with his friends. In Storyland, everybody plays hiding in different places. But who is hiding where?

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Pop wakes up with a great idea. Today shell write her very own musical. But as she gets started, Uncle Joe calls her in for breakfast. Then, she must help with heaps of boring jobs. Will Pop get time to write her musical?

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Hoopla is having a dance party and everyone is excited except Ziggy who thinks he is far too clumsy to dance.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Using his duck caller, the Sound Collector sets off to try and find some ducks to talk to.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its a windy day and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop. And he wants to do it all by himself.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are visiting their big cousin Chloe. Today is a special day because Peppa and George are meeting Chloes new baby brother, Alexander for the first time.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer cant believe his luck - he has a winning ticket! He just needs to keep it safe until morning and theres only one dog for the job! Can Bitzer rescue the winning ticket, or has he lost the Farmers fortune?

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy offers to look after Miss Pawdry, claiming that shes great with animals. But the cat escapes and ends up in a basket drifting towards the sea!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants fish for dinner, so he goes out fishing with Mr Elf, Ben and Holly on Mr Elfs boat. Mr Elf tells them a story about the biggest, baddest fish ever - Big Bad Barry. The King wants to catch Barry for supper.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The parents are having a clear-out. The good thing is anything they dont want, can go to the charity shop to help others. With their collection of things in a box, they set off to town and visit the Charity Shop.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma talks Big Trev into letting the cadets stay overnight in the submarine for the annual coral spawning, but their dreamy adventure gets derailed when they nearly crash into a sleep-swimming Charlene!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Lobo and the Super Monsters learn that creativity and teamwork can create magic, even without powers.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Rock Band
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay start their own rock band! But Nikhil is deflated when Jay keeps inviting other people to join the band. Nikhil wants it to be just the two of them.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie plays a board game with best friends Nina and Akil, learning how to deal with feelings of impatience, winning and losing.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: How does sound travel? In an episode sprinkled with fun, Michelle creates a Seeing Sound Sprinkle Sensation experiment to discover how sound waves travel.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The Alphablocks celebrate Os birthday with all the fun of the fair. This episode introduces the AIR, URE, ER and EAR letter teams.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George meet Kylie Kangaroo and her brother Joey. Peppa shows Kylie how to jump up and down in muddy puddles, but who can jump the highest?

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie thinks theres a ghost in the house, she and her mom become the Most Magnificent ghost hunters!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Little Woo and Seamus call Stanley to help them build a den so they can watch the bugs in the forest without disturbing them.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The story continues after Luna secretly stole Motsukis teleport power. Gekko and Catboy investigate, but mess up with catastrophic results... Can they find it in themselves to put it right?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma talks Big Trev into letting the cadets stay overnight in the submarine for the annual coral spawning, but their dreamy adventure gets derailed when they nearly crash into a sleep-swimming Charlene!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is asked to help at the animal park for the day and realises theres more to the job than he first thought.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners make an arty leaf mobile for their balcony using fallen leaves theyve collected.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come along on a fun-filled food adventure with The Wiggles! Dance along to classics like Hot Potato and Fruit Salad and sing along with a new favourite Marshmallow for a delicious episode of Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Frankies bad day worsens at the museum, but his friends teach him the value of teamwork, honesty, and leaning on others when things go wrong.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: To celebrate Freddy Foxs birthday the children go on a trip to a Dinosaur Park. With Grampy Rabbit as their leader, they follow dinosaur footprints to find Freddys birthday treat.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy wants to prove himself a fast driver so powers his cat racer with a moon crystal and blasts into space.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Theres an ice rink in the Park and Mr. Gruber teaches Paddington how to skate for the ice disco but will be brave the ice himself again after a past fall?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Springtime in the Little Kingdom brings out tulips, daffodils, hedgehogs...and two very hungry gnomes. Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf come up with a plan to stop the gnomes from eating everything in sight.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Normally Mission Command-bound, Jennie is super-excited to travel in Star Bird-1 to observe a pod of the Space Whales but isnt thrilled when the Rocket Club keep scaring off the whales.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Today is Dibillos birthday! All the friends go to see the Pat-A Cake Baker, who makes a very special birthday cake for Dibillo. Mr Onion insists on carrying the enormous birthday cake himself. What can possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: When Glenda sprains her ankle, Beep, Mort and Pop offer to look after her store. They have lots of new ideas, including home delivery. But its boring when no one visits. That is, until everyone returns with the wrong orders!

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Ziggy has a new magic trick that he wants to show all his friends. However he needs his magic hat to perfect the trick and his magic hat has gone missing.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector finds hidden sounds as he makes a new friend out in a field.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its bath time and Bing just cant help adding a few more squirts of bubble goo... and a few more... and a few more, until he gets more bubbles than he can handle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are going for a cycle ride. Peppa loves cycling downhill but shes not so keen on peddling uphill. So, when they meet Peppas friends and decide to have a race, Peppa insists it should be a downhill race.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer decides to pamper himself with a relaxing bath while the Farmer is away from the farm. However, his plans are rudely disturbed by a persistent intruder. Will Shaun be able to out-smart the tenacious bug?

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy and Sarah are making a film comparing dogs and cats, and the cats are clearly winninguntil a kitchen fire gives Nipper a chance to shine!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle does not want to get any older so decides that no one must celebrate his birthday. But all of the Little Kingdom has been waiting to celebrate the Kings birthday with a brilliant party.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are at playgroup. Today Madame Gazelle and all the children will be drawing pictures of their families.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets create a fun obstacle course for the Junior Junior Cadets, but when Reef and Roadie discover theres a prize at stake, they hilariously disguise themselves as babies to steal the spotlight!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Esmie and Igor discover the joys and challenges of babysitting Sami, a playful baby yeti, in a night full of chaos and laughter.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Adventure Park
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay are pretending to be at an adventure park with rides all around the house. Jay is devastated when he loses his beloved toy, Chickpea, along the way.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie prepares for Grandpas visit by tidying up, greeting him, and finally dealing with having to let him go.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can a car move without wheels? Alex has everything he needs to create a wheely cool car, except the wheels! Join Alex as he learns about friction by turning his wheel-less car into a hovercraft.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: G grows her green hair into a grassy garden and O makes a four-legged friend. This episode introduces the letters G and O and the words pot, pod, dog and dig.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: To celebrate Freddy Foxs birthday the children go on a trip to a Dinosaur Park. With Grampy Rabbit as their leader, they follow dinosaur footprints to find Freddys birthday treat.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Maya shows Millie and Ben her new ship-in-a-bottle, Captain Millie gets it in her head to build a real sailboat in her backyard.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Myrtle, Sophie and Benjamin call Stanley to teach them how to make a sandcastle. However, it gets ruined by some nearby crabs.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJMs defeat the Ninjas with ease, and become over-confident in their powers. But Night Ninjas secretly plotting to acquire PJ powers for himself.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas finds out that the Earls Technology Fair will bring new inventions to Sodor, he sets out to prove that steam engines are the best inventions ever.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the junior gardeners create a tree diary after visiting and learning about different types of trees on their tree scavenger hunt.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Spread joy and happiness with Caterina, Bubbles the Mermaid, and The Wiggles in this episode all about friendship!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: The Lost And The Furry One
programme.desc: Lobo loses his favourite items while playing, but with Zoes remembering song and help from the Super Monsters, he learns to retrace his steps and finds everything!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have been on a trip to a mountain beauty spot. When Daddy Pig loses the car keys down a drain Mr Bull offers to find them with his digger...

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy would rather be a superhero than babysit Tiny Timmy.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Whos trying to steal Mr. Currys prized Giant Pumpkin? PC Wells and Paddington are on the case.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: When Captain Squid leaves his treasure map in the Little Kingdom, Redbeard leads Ben, Holly and Nanny Plum on a treasure hunt. The map says the treasure is deep under water and guarded by a mermaid and a golden sea monster!

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Callie wants nothing more than to beat Calvin at the Intergalactic Rocket Races but must decide between winning and saving him when he drifts into an asteroid field.

programme.title: Anhs Brush With Fame
programme.desc: Talented Darwin girl Jessica Mauboy joins Anh in his arts studio to talk about her journey to chart and television success, and the family that made it possible.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Bianca Chatfield, Lanard Copeland and Vince Rugari discuss the start of the A-League mens competition, Constellation Cup netball, the Australian womens team at the ODI World Cup, plus NBL and WNBL.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: A routine defence training exercise ends in tragedy near Townsville, remote residents paying thousands of dollars for groceries just to survive, plus from the bush to the big time - could our next Matilda be from Borroloola?

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: Deep Time
programme.desc: Join Bridget Brennan and a panel of guests for a discussion about Deep Time, the epic story of Australia and its First Nations people.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Johnson Raela presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump has invited Australias Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to Washington DC for their first one-on-one meeting in person. Chas and John discuss what it all means for trade, AUKUS, defence and US-Australia relations.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong with the news from Asia: Dozens killed in clashes between Afghanistan and Pakistan, a deadly factory fire breaks out in Bangladesh, plus we meet the people keeping a Japanese subculture of decorated trucks alive.

programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Live: News Breakfast

programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.desc: All the fallout, reaction and analysis after Anthony Albaneses high-stakes meeting with President Donald Trump in Washington. Patricia Karvelas brings you the latest on trade, AUKUS, Rare Earths and Australia-US relations.
